thread.title: Cleveland Cavaliers vs. Philadelphia 76ers: Live chat and updates with Chris Fedor
thread.title_full: Cleveland Cavaliers vs. Philadelphia 76ers: Live chat and updates with Chris Fedor | cleveland.com

author: Chris Fedor, Northeast Ohio Media Group
title: Cleveland Cavaliers vs. Philadelphia 76ers: Live chat and updates with Chris Fedor
text:
PHILADELPHIA -- After opening the preseason Wednesday night in Cincinnati, the Cleveland Cavaliers head to Philadelphia for the second night of a back-to-back.
LeBron James will not play. The same for J.R. Smith and Timofey Mozgov. Kevin Love and Kyrie Irving are staying back in Cleveland for rehab, which means the Cavs will be without much of their starting lineup.
Follow along in the comments section as our Cavaliers team -- Chris Haynes, Joe Vardon and I -- will provide analysis and observations throughout the game.
Preseason Game 2: Cavs (0-1) vs. 76ers (0-1)
Tip off: 7 p.m. at Wells Fargo Center
TV/radio: Fox Sports Ohio, NBA TV; WTAM AM/1100, 87.7 FM (ESP)
Cavs probable starting lineup: Mo Williams, Matthew Dellavedova, Joe Harris, James Jones and Anderson Varejao.
76ers probable starting lineup: Isaiah Canaan, Hollis Thompson, Jerami Grant, Nerlens Noel and Jahlil Okafor.
FREQUENTLY REFRESH this page to get the latest updates. If you're viewing this on a mobile app, click here to get updates and comment.
